page.title: 11THE MUSEUM AT DEVIZES.
page.content: The Museum is the headquarters of the Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Society and is situated in Long Street. With so many sites of the early prehistoric period in the county,the collection of Neolithic,Bronze and Iron Age finds is outstanding. There are sixteen rooms in the Museum to display the antiquities which also include a fine selection of mounted natural history specimens of birds and animals. The Museum has been instrumental in the formation of a County Biological Records Centre which should help tremendously in the future conservation and study of wildlife in Wiltshire. The WATCH Group,the young people's branch of the Conservation Trust,meet regularly at the Museum.
